adjectives.description: slighting (comparative more slighting, superlative most slighting)

entries.meaning: In the manner of a slight; belittling, deprecative
The act of giving a slight or snub.
examples: […]  the rest, who had looked upon him with such disdainful neglect  […]  now flocked about him, striving who should express most respect, and, by an extraordinary officiousness, redeem their late slightings.

entries.meaning: (regional) An act of ignoring or neglecting someone or something; more broadly neglect.
(regional) The action of rejecting someone or something; rejection.
examples: The slighting of a handshake by Samuel ticked off Judi to no end.

entries.meaning: (military) The full or partial demolition of a fortification.

examples: His habit of slighting the company chairman was considered to be inappropriate behaviour.
